title.narrative: Technical assistance to the Government of Punjab to improve quality of education service delivery, promote equitable access to education, strengthen governance and management and build government capacity, benefiting girls and the most marginalised

description.narrative: This activity (Technical assistance to the Government of Punjab to improve quality of education service delivery, promote equitable access to education, strengthen governance and management and build government capacity, benefiting girls and the most marginalised) is a component of Punjab Education Support Programme II reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of Services' and a budget of £31,827,418. This component benefits Pakistan, and works in the following sector(s): Primary education, Secondary education, Higher education. , with the following implementing partners: Adam Smith International, Education Development Trust, McKinsey & Company, Mott MacDonald Limited, Oxford Policy Management. The start date is 01-04-2012 and the end date is 31-03-2022.

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA
